job_description:
DescriptionFor this role it would be required to work from the London office at least 1x per week.OverviewTeamITG is a leading technology company that specializes in delivering cutting-edge marketing and technological solutions to a diverse clientele worldwide. Our teams comprise of marketing automation specialists, consultants, front end/back end & data developers, client services professionals and campaign managers, as well as everything in between, who all working seamlessly to delivery award winning omni-channel campaigns on behalf of some of the most prestigious customers globally.The roleWe are in search of a dynamic and technically adept Marketing Technology Engineer to bolster our development team. As a Marketing Technology Engineer, your role will be integral within our CRM Cloud ETL Development team, tasked with the implementation and oversight of dynamic marketing technology solutions for our esteemed clients. This position offers a unique chance to collaborate with top-tier brands spanning multiple industries, providing invaluable hands-on exposure to the dynamic realm of marketing technology. Join us at the forefront of innovation and make your mark in this rapidly evolving field.In addition to leveraging your expertise in SQL-based tasks, this role offers an exciting avenue for growth into cloud computing, cloud ETL, and associated services provided by industry leaders like Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS). Moreover, you'll delve into our extensive data repositories utilizing tools such as Python and Apache Airflow.As a vital member of our team, you'll collaborate closely with Technical Consultants and fellow team members to grasp client needs, devise technical solutions, and ensure seamless implementation and operation of marketing technology platforms and systems. Join us in shaping the future of marketing technology!RequirementsMain Duties and ResponsibilitiesSQL Development:Craft robust SQL scripts, queries, views, and stored procedures to efficiently manipulate and retrieve data from diverse sources.Python Development:Create bespoke scripts and applications with Python to streamline marketing operations and ETL processes, facilitate system integration, and enhance marketing analytics capabilities.ETL Process Development:Design, develop, and rigorously test ETL processes, predominantly cloud-based, to seamlessly extract, transform, and load data into target systems.Marketing Technology Configuration and Customisation: Manage the implementation of marketing technology solutions, including configuring and customizing marketing technology platforms to support targeted marketing initiatives and ensuring seamless integration with other systems.Database Design and Optimization: Develop and refine database structures to ensure streamlined data storage, retrieval, and manipulation for optimal efficiency.Cloud Computing Integration: Leverage cloud computing technologies (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services) to enhance data integration capabilities and optimize system performance.Stakeholder Collaboration:Engage with stakeholders across departments to comprehend data requirements thoroughly and devise optimal solutions to address business needs effectively.Data Quality Assurance:Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and consistency of data through meticulous testing and validation procedures.Performance Optimization:Enhance the performance, scalability, and reliability of ETL processes through continuous optimization efforts.Monitoring and Error Handling:Implement robust monitoring and error-handling mechanisms to ensure the smooth execution of ETL jobs and promptly address any anomalies.Issue Resolution:Troubleshoot and resolve data integration and ETL process-related issues in a timely and efficient manner to minimize disruptions.Documentation and Version Control:Thoroughly document processes according to company standards, encompassing technical specifications, data mappings, and workflow diagrams, and maintain all work in a designated source control repository.Post-Implementation Support:Provide ongoing support for implemented processes post-go-live and proactively implement enhancements to optimize performance and functionality. Industry Awareness:Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging trends in cloud data integration to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement.Research and Development:Participate in research and development initiatives focused on evaluating and integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data integration capabilities.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of projects, fostering a collaborative and cohesive working environment.Technical Leadership:Provide technical leadership and guidance to other teams, including mentoring and coaching junior team members by providing guidance on best practices, technical skills development, and project execution.RequirementsExperience in ETL development. A proven track record of 5+ years in ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) development, demonstrating comprehensive expertise in designing, implementing, and maintaining data integration processes across various systems and platforms.Proficiency in SQL Development:Demonstrated expertise in SQL development, encompassing ad-hoc SQL, stored procedures, functions, and other querying techniques.Experience with Microsoft SQL Server:Proven track record of working with Microsoft SQL Server, preferably proficient in T-SQL scripting and administration. Database Design and Data Modelling:Understanding and practical experience in database design principles and data modelling methodologies. ETL Conceptual Proficiency:Comprehensive understanding of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) concepts, along with familiarity with industry best practices. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite:Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services):Hands-on experience in developing, deploying, and maintaining SSIS packages for data extraction, transformation, and loading tasks. Proficiency in Python:Proficiency in Python programming language, with the ability to write scripts and automate tasks related to data processing and analysis. Experience with Cloud Technologies:Practical experience with cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Amazon Web Services (AWS), including familiarity with cloud-based data storage, compute, and analytics services. Analytical and Troubleshooting Skills:Exceptional troubleshooting abilities coupled with critical thinking skills and meticulous attention to detail. Effective Communication Skills:Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly and concisely. Collaborative Team Player:Strong ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment, fostering effective communication and collaboration across different departments and stakeholders. Passion for Data and Continuous Learning:Enthusiasm for working with data, coupled with a strong desire to learn and adapt to new technologies and industry trends.BenefitsWork’s a treat!On top of a competitive salary, you can expect a whole load of perks: 25 days’ holiday + bank holidays – we understand the importance of you getting some down time. Annual Wellbeing Day – enjoy an additional day on us to look after your physical and mental wellbeing.  Pension Scheme – helping you save towards your retirement home in the sun!  Corporate Medical Cash Plan – claim back the cost of your medical treatments.  Smart Working Options – spend up to 40% of your working week from home.  So many savings – through our online community platform, you can access dozens of daily deals, from money off top brands to discounts on days out.  Employee Assistance Programme – our people are at the heart of everything we do, so if you’re happy, we’re happy.  Cycle to Work Scheme – save on the cost of biking to work. Who We Are Looking ForWe are looking for an Active Directory Operations Engineer with strong working knowledge of AD sites, Replication topology, GPO’s, DNS, WINS & ADFS. Capable of independently managing and perform engineering lead role for large enterprise scale Active Directory and Identity Management projects. Analyze current Active Directory environment to identify technical and operational challenges and develop solutions for improvement.HYBRID: This role can be performed in a hybrid model, where you can balance work from home and office to match your needs and role requirements.What You Will Be Responsible ForAs an Active Directory Operations Engineer you will have,Minimum of 5 to 10 years - direct experience building and supporting Microsoft Active Directory in large enterprise environments3 – 5 years of experience supporting Microsoft ADFS3 – 5 years of experience supporting Microsoft Azure Active Directory3 years of experience supporting Azure AD Connect5+ years supporting Microsoft Server (various versions)A working knowledge of the Quest suite of Active Directory related tools.Strong troubleshooting skills & methodologyStrong working knowledge of DNS & WINSExperience working on Security initiatives related to Active Directory.Ability to collaborate on engineering documentation including:Requirements documentsEngineering documentsStandard Operating ProceduresAbility to work across technology teams when required.Experience working on large projects in AD or ADFS engineering roleWhat We ValueThese skills will help you succeed in this roleExcellent communications skills - both verbal and writtenAble to work with little to no supervision in technical realmHigh level of self-motivationWorks well in teams of technical and non-technical peoplePositive attitude toward learning new things technical and non-technicalEducation & Preferred QualificationsBachelors or Masters degree5-10 years of direct experience building and supporting Microsoft Active Directory in large enterprise environments3-5 years of experience supporting Microsoft ADFS10+ years supporting Microsoft Server (various versions)Excellent troubleshooting skillsExcellent working knowledge of DNS & WINSExperience working on Security initiatives related to Active Directory.Ability to develop engineering documentation including:Requirements documentsEngineering documentsStandard Operating ProceduresAbility to work across technology teams with ease.Experience working on large projects in technical leadership roleAre you the right candidate? Yes!We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don’t necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.Why this role is important to usOur technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.About State StreetWhat we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Job ID: R-737407

Job ID 2401475Location LONDON, ENG, GBDate Posted 2024-01-30Category Engineering and SciencesSubcategory Systems EngineerSchedule Full-timeShift Day JobTravel Yes, 10 % of the TimeMinimum Clearance Required TS/SCI With PolyClearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain NonePotential for Remote Work NoDescriptionJOB DESCRIPTIONSAIC is seeking a Systems Engineer to work on complex projects crucial to our national security objectives. He/she will provide Systems Engineering and Technical Advisory (SETA) services at a customer facility in the United Kingdom.Relocation assistance may be provided as well as housing stipend, cost of living, and other allowances for the duration of the tour.Key responsibilitiesPrimarily support Chief Engineer and Systems Engineering and Integration (SE&I) leadership team in executing systems engineering activities across site.Provide technical support to maintain continuity of operations and anomaly response processes and help with the planning for resiliency related activitiesAnalyze systems engineering activities and provide recommendations to multiple government customers; deliver key information, possible risks and impacts and associated handling plans; assess opportunities and potential improvements to government managers and other points of contact.Analyze and document site system architecture and impacts associated with system updates/deliveriesCoordinate with government project managers to evaluate contractor performance and provide written and oral feedback consistent with findings and/or reviews.Coordinate with the site engineering teams, review site workflows and processes necessary to ensure site baseline is documented and managed to enable future mission planning and growth.Ensure SE&I team adheres to site engineering processes and standards throughout all phases of the system lifecycle management process.Collaborate with Headquarters Directorates, site organizations, and mission partners to ensure understanding of project requirements and risks (cost, schedule, technical). Help develop standards, tools, and procedures for use on projects including but not limited to issue risk, change and information management.QualificationsRequired Must be a US Citizen.Active TS/SCI clearance with CI polygraph.Bachelor’s degree in science, technology, engineering, mathematics (STEM) or relevant field required and nine (9) years or more relevant experience; master’s and seven (7) years or more experience.Knowledge of customer’s space and ground domain mission and technical capabilities.Demonstrated experience with government customer’s systems engineering, mission readiness, and project management methods, familiar with site mission and ground systems integration processes.Systems engineering background; understanding of systems development life cycle from concept, requirements, engineering design, integration and test, deployment, maintenance, through decommissioning.Experience in requirements definition, system architectures, systems analysis and design, interface and data architectures, validation, and verification.Polished communicator and proven collaborator; demonstrated ability to coordinate across all levels of government to ensure contracts effectively deliver required services and capabilities.Self-starter, proactively addresses customer requirements with no supervision; expert at defining solutions for broad, abstract topics.Familiar with model-based systems engineering and digital engineering concepts and tools; Agile development methodology, cloud technologies.DesiredDirect and current experience with customer.Familiar with COOP processes.Familiar with Confluence, JIRA.Self-motivated with positive interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills.Extensive recent familiarity with agency’s missions and organizations preferred.INCOSE Systems Engineering certifications are a plus.SAIC accepts applications on an ongoing basis and there is no deadline.Covid Policy SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.
